SEARCH
Package grafioschtrader.reports.udfalluserfields

Class AllUserFieldsSecurity

java.lang.Object
grafioschtrader.reports.udfalluserfields.AllUserFieldsSecurity
Direct Known Subclasses:
YahooUDFFields, YieldToMaturityCalculator
public abstract class AllUserFieldsSecurity extends Object
Abstract base class for managing security-related user-defined fields across all users in the system. This class provides common functionality for implementing UDF operations that apply to all users for security entities, including field value management, metadata retrieval, and asset class matching. The class serves as a foundation for concrete implementations that handle specific types of security UDF operations, such as calculating derived values, updating field data, or generating reports based on security characteristics and user-defined field configurations.
Key responsibilities include:
- Managing UDF data persistence for security entities at the system level (user ID 0)
- Handling JSON-based field value storage and retrieval for watchlist contexts
- Providing asset class and investment instrument matching for UDF applicability
- Centralizing security UDF metadata access and validation
Subclasses typically implement specific business logic for different types of security UDF operations while leveraging the common infrastructure provided by this base class.

  • Method Details

    • putValueToJsonValue

      protected void putValueToJsonValue(SecuritycurrencyUDFGroup securitycurrencyUDFGroup, UDFMetadataSecurity udfMetaDataSecurity, int idSecurity, Object value, boolean persits)
      Updates UDF field values in both watchlist context and persistent storage for a specific security. This method handles the dual storage of UDF values: in-memory for watchlist display and persistent storage for system-wide availability. The method manages JSON serialization and ensures data consistency across both storage mechanisms.
      Parameters:
      securitycurrencyUDFGroup - the UDF group containing watchlist and field data context
      udfMetaDataSecurity - the metadata definition for the UDF field being updated
      idSecurity - the ID of the security entity for which the field value is being set
      value - the field value to be stored (will be serialized appropriately based on field type)
      persits - true if the value should be persisted to database storage, false for in-memory only

    • getMetadataSecurity

      protected UDFMetadataSecurity getMetadataSecurity(IUDFSpecialType udfSpecialType)
      Retrieves UDF security metadata for a specific special type from the system-wide definitions. This method accesses metadata definitions that are available to all users (user ID 0) for the specified UDF special type, providing the field configuration and validation rules.
      Parameters:
      udfSpecialType - the special type identifier for the UDF field
      Returns:
      the UDF security metadata definition for the specified special type

    • matchAssetclassAndSpecialInvestmentInstruments

      protected boolean matchAssetclassAndSpecialInvestmentInstruments(UDFMetadataSecurity udfMetadataSecurity, Assetclass assetclass)
      Determines if a security's asset class characteristics match the UDF metadata field applicability criteria. This method checks whether the security's category type and special investment instrument fall within the scope defined by the UDF metadata configuration, ensuring that UDF fields are only applied to appropriate security types.
      Parameters:
      udfMetadataSecurity - the UDF metadata containing the applicable category types and investment instruments
      assetclass - the asset class of the security to be checked for UDF field applicability
      Returns:
      true if the asset class matches the UDF metadata criteria and the field should be applied, false if the security type is not within the UDF field's scope
